授業目的: This course relativizes Japan to better understand its position in the contemporary world. Examining topical issues from the cultural and social to the economic and political, this course encourages students to look afresh at Japanese society by way of international comparison.
到達目標: After taking this course, students will gain a deepened and more critical understanding of contemporary Japan in view of current debates over culture, society, and politics around the world. They will also improve on their skills of argumentation, expository writing, and oral presentation.
特記事項:
この科目は、4/28（木）までの授業がオンデマンドで実施される科目です。
5/2（月）以降の授業は対面での実施が決定しました。本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course will be offered on-demand until Thursday, April 28.
Classes will be held in a face-to-face format from Monday, May 2 onward.
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Classes 1-3 will be available on demand. This course adopts “reversed classroom” format: classes will consist mainly of student presentations and discussion with occasional mini lectures.
